Description: Body sherd of East Greek Late Wild Goat Style pottery bowl; white slip; interior: black with traces of band in added red and another in added white; exterior: part of tendril with four short vertical bars; dot rosette as filling ornament; below, wide black band with band in added red lined in white; below, key maeander frieze and further band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Modern inscription written in ink NAU 5' on break (accession number used in clay analysis). According to Dupont and Thomas (2006, p.80 NAU5), the geochemical characteristics of the fabric point to an origin in the region of Teos.
Bibliographic references: Dupont & Thomas 2006 / Naukratis: Les Importations Grecques Orientales Archaïques (p. 78-9, fig. 1, p. 80) (NAU 5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1031)
